cleaned_text: A personalised news feed of stories that matter to you [Learn more](/mynews?module=myNEWS_text&pgtype=article) 13 things you may not know about Ayurveda - Ayurveda, the 'Science of Life', is a natural system of medicine with roots in India, that dates back more than 3,000 years. Based on the idea that good health can only be achieved if an individual's three energies, or doshas, are in balance, Ayurveda promotes lifestyle changes and natural therapies that use herbs, oils, massage, meditation and yoga to regain a balance between the body, mind, spirit, and the environment. 1. What is Ayurveda? Traditional Indian medicine that dates back more than 3,000 years. [Learn more](https://www.scmp.com/lifestyle/health-wellness/article/3121103/what-ayurveda-history-treatments-and-doshas-traditional?module=inline&pgtype=article) 2. Can Ayurveda help couples with infertility issues conceive? Yes, say these three women. [Learn more](https://www.scmp.com/lifestyle/health-wellness/article/3125002/3-women-who-got-pregnant-after-ayurvedic-treatment-talk?module=inline&pgtype=article) 3. How does Ayurveda differ from Western medicine? Ayurveda treats the individual rather than the disease. The Ayurvedic doctors asks is 'who' is my patient, not what is my patient's ailment. [Learn more](https://www.scmp.com/lifestyle/health-wellness/article/2173202/how-ayurveda-improved-sceptical-singapore-mans-life-so?module=inline&pgtype=article) 4. What is 'mixopathy'? India's plan to mix modern and Ayurvedic medicine. [Learn more](https://www.scmp.com/lifestyle/health-wellness/article/3114152/indian-plan-combine-modern-and-ayurvedic-medicine?module=inline&pgtype=article) 5. How can Ayurvedic medicine help cancer fighters? They learn yoga, new ways to breathe, and to eat more healthily. [Learn more](https://www.scmp.com/lifestyle/health-wellness/article/3007861/pancreatic-cancer-survivor-tells-how-wellness-therapy?module=inline&pgtype=article) 6. Which tree is known as the Miracle Tree or Tree of Life? Moringa - with the highest nutritional value among 120 foods studied. [Learn more](https://www.scmp.com/lifestyle/health-wellness/article/3009712/five-indian-healing-foods-ginger-garlic-turmeric?module=inline&pgtype=article) 7. Why eat lotus seeds and fox nuts? Lotus seeds help prevent cancer, boost immunity and relieve depression, stress and anxiety. Fox nuts are a high-protein, low-fat popcorn alternative. [Learn more](https://www.scmp.com/lifestyle/health-wellness/article/3094950/lotus-seeds-super-food-used-ayurveda-and-tcm-why-they-are?module=inline&pgtype=article) 8. What foods are good for boosting our immune system? Gooseberries, neem, giloy, sprouted 9. What is vetiver? A tall grass that's cultivated for the oil distilled from its roots, used in fragrances and to alleviate stress. [Learn more](https://www.scmp.com/lifestyle/health-wellness/article/3118179/benefits-vetiver-oil-used-ayurvedic-medicine-diet-and?module=inline&pgtype=article) 10. What is ashwaganda? Super herb that helps you look younger and live longer - and may improve your sex life. [Learn more](https://www.scmp.com/lifestyle/health-wellness/article/3114453/ashwagandha-ayurvedic-super-herb-helps-you-look-younger?module=inline&pgtype=article) 11. Ayurveda was one of the tools which actress used to beat blood cancer? Indian Canadian Lisa Ray. [Learn more](https://www.scmp.com/lifestyle/health-wellness/article/2183677/how-indian-canadian-actress-lisa-rays-blood-cancer-battle?module=inline&pgtype=article) 12.
